textos_fuente.text: District Special Events | Pinellas Park, FL Skip to Main Content Departments City Government Projects Online Services How Do I... Search Home Departments Community Development Planning & Development Services Community Redevelopment Agency (CRA) Community Redevelopment District District Special Events District Special Events The Community Redevelopment District is the site of numerous special events each year.  These events bring hundreds of thousands of people to the downtown area and generate interest in the District. The CRA Police Unit co-hosts several community events including: Citizens Police Academy National Night Out Operation Medicine Cabinet “Treat Trail” at the Shoppes at Park Place, where businesses play host to safe, family-friendly Halloween celebrations. Each month the Pinellas Park Fire Fighters host Movies in the Park at England Brothers Park. Country in the Park England Brothers Park is also the location for the City’s annual Country in the Park festival and trade show, a free event held each March that includes musical performances by nationally-known and local musicians, arts and crafts, pony rides, a car show, children’s activities and much more. On the evening preceding Country in the Park, the Firefighters host the annual Chili Blaze, a chili cook-off to benefit the Muscular Dystrophy Association. This event also offers live music, over 50 different chili teams competing for the "Chili Champion's" trophy, and a large fireworks display. Pinellas Country Fair & Rodeo The City now also participates in hosting the annual Pinellas Country Fair at England Brothers Park, complete with its very own Rodeo. Pinellas Park Performing Arts Center The Pinellas Park Performing Arts Center, hosts a full season of sold-out concerts; for additional information, see the monthly calendar on the City of Pinellas Park home page. In addition, the Center hosts regular performances by the Pinellas Park Civic Orchestra and Matinee Opera Players. Holiday Parade The City's historic downtown, located along the Park Boulevard corridor, is the site of the annual December Holiday Parade, a community favorite. Pinellas Arts Village Beginning in 2015, the downtown also became the site of a new and growing Pinellas Arts Village, which offers the Fourth Saturday Art Walk during January-November, and a special Holiday Art Walk in December, as well as individual shows and events hosted by resident artists and creative businesses. Join Our Team | Pinellas Park, FL Skip to Main Content Departments City Government Projects Online Services How Do I... Search Home Departments Police Your Police Join Our Team Join Our Team The City of Pinellas Park is an Equal Opportunity Employer The Pinellas Park Police Department has an authorized strength of 106 full time police officers. The Recruiting Unit is responsible for the recruitment and background investigation of all candidates who request consideration for employment as police officers. In addition to our own in house investigators, the agency also utilizes the services of Police Applicant Screening Services (PASS) to conduct preliminary background investigations on all potential police candidates. The completion of the PASS process is necessary to be considered for employment as a police officer with the Pinellas Park Police Department. For more information on the PASS process and to link directly to their website, please click the link above. Equal Employment Opportunity The City of Pinellas Park is an equal opportunity employer. EOT VERIFICATION PROCESS The Exemption From Training (EOT) process provided by PASS is for out-of-state officers, federal officers and previously certified Florida officers with a four year or more break-in-service pursuant to section 943.131(2a), Florida Statutes and Rule 11B-35.009(3) or (4), Florida Administrative Code. The EOT allows a former officer to be exempt from having to complete the full basic recruit academy. For more information about the EOT process please click HERE . Contact Us Benson Dimaculangan Professional Standards Detective Phone: 727-369-7828 Benefits 10 Holidays Per Year 100 Hours of Paid Vacation (Additional Hours Accrue With Longevity) 16 Hrs Personal Leave 12 Hour Shifts with alternating weekends off 96 Hours Paid Sick Leave Per Year Credit Union Membership Deferred Compensation Available (457 Program) Dental Coverage Available Direct Payroll Deposit 3 Year Deferred Retirement Option Program ( DROP ) Employee Assistance Program Funeral / Bereavement Leave Health Insurance at Low Cost to Employee in-House Fitness Center Life Insurance Available Long Term Disability Option Military Leave Paid Jury Duty Paid Training Programs Pension Plan Spouse and Dependent Dental Coverage Available Spouse and Dependent Health Coverage Available Supplemental Life Insurance Available Take-Home Vehicle (Surrounding Counties) Uniforms and Equipment Provided Qualifications Be at least 19 years of age Be a citizen of the United States Be a high school graduate or its equivalent Be in good physical condition as determined by a physician's examination and successfully pass analysis for controlled substances Be of good moral character. Have completed at least 30 hours at an accredited college, be in good standing (not on probation) during your last attendance, and have an overall GPA of at least 2.0 (on a 4 point scale) Never have received a dishonorable discharge from any of the Armed Forces of the United States Not have been convicted of any felony or of a misdemeanor involving perjury or false statement Possess a valid driver's license Selection Process As a candidate for the position of a police officer, you will be expected to successfully complete and or pass the following: Background Investigation Completion of the Pass Process Meet Agency Approved Drug and Tobacco Policy Oral Board Interview Oral Interview Patrol Ride-Along Evaluation Physical Examination Polygraph Examination Psychological Examination Salary Starting Salary $65,545.22 $30 Per Month Additional for a 2-Year College Degree $80 Per Month Additional for a 4-Year College Degree Advanced Training Incentive Pay Overtime Pay Secondary Employment Details (Available to Supplement Officers' Salaries) Court Standby Pay Additional Information For additional information on the selection process or to learn more about the job opportunities at the Pinellas Park Police Department, please contact us at Pinellas Park Police Department Recruiting Unit. Attention to: Detective B. Dimaculangan 7700 59 Street N Pinellas Park, FL 33781 Phone: 727-369-7828 Fax: 727-369-5703 Email: recruiter@pinellas-park.com Chief Adam Geissenberger Chief Adam Geissenberger Executive Staff Our Philosophy Accreditation Internal Affairs Records Join Our Team Honor Guard Investigation Division Criminal Investigation Section Cold Case Files Special Investigations Unit Public Information Unit Operations Division Patrol Special Operations K - 9 Traffic Unit Traffic Homicide Cold Cases Services Division Community Compliance Report a Violation FAQs Helpful Links Community Compliance Staff Directory Community Policing Unit Community Policing Unit Crime Prevention SWAT Youth Services Training Unit Staff Directory Officer Of The Year Contact Us Police Department 7700 59th Street Pinellas Park, FL 33781 Phone: 727-369-7864 Quick Links Click & Fix Veterans’ Preference Information Privacy Policy /QuickLinks.aspx Site Links Website Accessibility Copyright Notices Sitemap ADA Assistance /QuickLinks.aspx Government Websites by CivicPlus® Loading Loading Do Not Show Again Close Arrow Left Arrow Right [] Slideshow Left Arrow Slideshow Right Arrow

FAQs • *Who do I talk to about renting England Brothers Park Skip to Main Content Departments City Government Projects Online Services How Do I... Search Home FAQs *Who do I talk to about renting England Brothers Park or the events going on at EBP? For inquiries about events or rentals at England Brothers Park, email events@pinellas-park.com .  You can also call during the M-F workweek at 727-369-5735. Parks Show All Answers 1. What's the best way to report a maintenance or repair issue at a park? See.Click.Fix allows for convenient reporting at any time, any day of the week. Everyone in the community can see what issues have been reported, minimizing duplicate reports for the same issues and allowing the Parks Maintenance team to more easily track recurring issues. You can also call our Public Works office between 8 am - 5 pm Monday-Friday at 727-369-5850.  If you encounter an issue of serious safety concern at one of the parks during the evening or weekend, please call our police department at 727-369-7864; they have the ability to reach the appropriate Public Works team to address the issue. (Please note that the dispatcher answering the phone may ask for the park address since the dispatch office covers multiple areas in Pinellas County.) 2. How do I rent a park pavilion? Use the CivicRec online reservation software to view availability and rent a park pavilion up to 1 year in advance. Half-day and full-day rates are available. If you prefer to make payment by cash or check, or need in-person assistance navigating the software, you can visit any recreation center. 3. *Who do I talk to about renting England Brothers Park or the events going on at EBP? For inquiries about events or rentals at England Brothers Park, email events@pinellas-park.com .  You can also call during the M-F workweek at 727-369-5735.
